clinical_study.brief_title: Difference in the Estimation of Prognosis
clinical_study.official_title: What is the Difference in the Estimation of Prognosis of Advanced Cancer Patients Between Medical Oncologist, Gynecological Oncologists, and Palliative Care Physicians?

brief_summary.textblock:
Objectives:
Primary Objective:
The primary objective is to identify the difference in the estimation of prognosis of advanced cancer patients between medical oncologists, gynecological oncologists, and palliative care physicians

detailed_description.textblock: The goal of this research study is to identify the difference in the estimation of prognosis of advanced cancer patients between medical or gynecological oncologists, and palliative care physicians. Up to 140 patients will be enrolled in this study.

primary_outcome.measure: Estimation of Patient Overall Survival by Oncologists and by Palliative Care Physicians per Estimation of Prognosis Questionnaire
primary_outcome.description: The answer to the question #4, "How long do you think this patient will live?" in the questionnaire is the primary endpoint. Denoting the oncologist estimated OS time from the day of palliative care consult to death by TOnc, palliative care physician estimate by TPalliative, and the true OS time by T0, we define the accuracy of the estimation of OS by oncologists and by palliative care physician as ΔOnc = TOnc - T0 ΔPalliative = TPalliative - T0. And the difference between these two estimates is calculated as ΔOS = ΔOnc - ΔPalliative. Based on the above formulas, ΔOS is actually calculated as (TOnc- TPalliative). The true survival time, T0, is cancelled out by the subtraction.

clinical_study.condition: Malignant Neoplasms of Independent (Primary) Multiple Sites

arm_group.description: Medical oncology physicians are sent the Estimation of Prognosis questionnaire by email.
Palliative care physicians are sent the Estimation of Prognosis questionnaire by email.

intervention.description: Survey will examine two aspects of prognosis estimation: 1.) physician factors, 2.) prognosis estimation and contributing factors to patient prognosis. Survey will take approximately 5 minutes to complete.

study_pop.textblock: Medical oncologists and palliative care physicians from UT MD Anderson Cancer Center

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. Medical oncologists or gynecological who referred patients to the palliative care team; Palliative Care physicians to whom the patients were referred; Patients with locally advanced, metastatic, or, not curable cancer.
2. 18 years old or older
